newsitem.title: USA: UPS unit buys Boston's Copley Place - report.
newsitem.headline: UPS unit buys Boston's Copley Place - report.

text.p: Boston's swank Copley Place, a multi-use complex, was sold for about $300 million to Overseas Investment Corp, a Bermuda investment company controlled by United Parcel Service of America Inc, the Boston Business Journal reported Friday.

The purchase from JMB Realty Corp, a Chicago-based real estate investment firm, included the retail, office and parking garage components of the 3.5 million-square-foot complex in Boston's Back Bay neighborhood, the weekly business newspaper said quoting unnamed sources. But the sale did not include the two hotels: the 1,147-room Boston Marriott Copley Place and the 800-room Westin Hotel Copley Place.

Copley Place includes a multi-screen cinema, 800,000 square feet of office space and 300,000 square feet of retail space occupied by about 100 shops and a parking garage. JMB became the owner in 1984.
Officials from JMB and UPS could not be reached for comment. (( --Boston bureau, 617-367-4106))
